trans-unit.source: Please type the correct password directly into the text box below and click the button below.
The Password you entered is incorrect. Please try again.

source.g: An Einstein Analytics consultant is working on a dataset where row-level security needs to be implemented.
How can the user accomplish this?
Define a security predicate, turn on sharing inheritance, or do both.
Correct. To restrict access to records, you can implement row-level security on a dataset when you use sharing inheritance and security predicates.
Enable field-level security on a dataset.
Incorrect. Field-level security does not implement row-level security on a dataset.
Adjust the user’s profile to determine row-level security on a dataset.
Incorrect. Adjusting the user’s profile affects all users with that profile and does not determine row-level security on a dataset.
Create a permission set to enable row-level sharing on a dataset.
Incorrect. Permission sets do not enable row-level sharing on a dataset in Einstein Analytics.
1. Change the “X” in “Question 1 of X” to the total number of questions (do this on all questions).
2. Type or paste the questions in the questions section.
3. Type or paste the answers in the answer sections.
4. Type or paste the feedback for each answer.
5. In slide actions, click script_window and adjust the following:
= number of correct answers for this question
- ans1 = the letter of the correct answer
- ans2 = if there is a second correct answer, change to the applicable answer letter
- ans3 = if there is a third correct answer, change to the applicable answer letter
If you need an option E (a fifth answer)
2. Re-position all the items back into the fluid boxes (drag until box turns green).
3. From the last slide, copy and paste the three items to the appropriate emply fluid boxes.
4. Click each of the three items and ensure the labels (in Properties tab) are as follows:
An Einstein Analytics consultant wants to restrict row-level access within the dataset to only users who own the specific records.
How can a user achieve this through a security predicate?
Incorrect. Record.Id is not the correct field to use.
Incorrect. UserId is not the correct field to use.
Correct. OwnerId refers to the dataset column that contains the user ID of the owner of the record. While $User.Id refers to the Id column of the User object.
Incorrect. Role.Id is not the correct field to use.
